Vestige spryly lept into the seat inside Tuscon's cab. He closed the
doo=
r and took a moment to look around, glancing at the different
controls that=
 Tuscon had. "You look like something I have seen before,
but I can't place=
 where." Vestige look confused for a moment, as his
voice trailed off thoug=
htfully.

After a moment he shook it off. "We have to go that way." he said=

pointing down the hall. The hall had gotten a little darker, as if the
lig=
hts had been turned down a notch or two, but the way ahead was
still clearl=
y visable.

Vestige lay a hand on Tuscon's steering wheel as he placed a fo=
ot on
his accelerator, "I don't know how much more time we have . . . I . .=

I . . have, so we have to go." Vestige's voice was already getting a
littl=
e shaky, but he swallowed it as he tried to engage Tuscon's
engines to star=
t them moving.

Outside the vehicle the lights continued to slowly dim and =
the
scraping noises were getting louder and more insistant. It began to
sou=
nd like metal blades sliding along steel shelled amor and in the

here it was coming from was difficult to tell.
